info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 24 at 8:59PM MST until January 25 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST /MIDNIGHT CST/ TUESDAY... * WHAT...Moderate to heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 7 inches. * WHERE...Entire Tri-State area. * WHEN...From 11 PM MST /midnight CST/ this evening to 11 PM MST /midnight CST/ Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow will develop in northeast Colorado and southwest Nebraska overnight, expanding south and east to Interstate 70 by sunrise. The heaviest snow, and majority of snow accumulation, is anticipated to occur between sunrise and noon. Snow will gradually taper off from north to south during the afternoon and evening. Accumulations reaching or exceeding 6 inches are possible across portions of the Interstate 70 corridor in northwest Kansas, where a narrow band of heavy snow may develop late Tuesday morning. Considerable uncertainty persists with regard to where exactly this band of heavy snow will occur. Total snow accumulations may vary considerably from county to county.
info.instruction: Travel conditions may rapidly deteriorate along the Interstate 70 corridor Tuesday morning. If you must travel, slow down, turn off cruise control, and exercise additional caution, particularly at intersections and highway on-ramps and off-ramps where accidents are more likely to occur. Decelerating abruptly or making sharp turns at a high rate of speed may result in loss of vehicle control. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
